alert.note: Alert for Charles City; Prince George; Surry (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 11:29PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Charles City, northeastern Prince George and northwestern Surry Counties through MIDNIGHT EDT... At 1129 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Burrowsville, or 7 miles northeast of Disputanta, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Burrowsville around 1135 PM EDT. Cabin Point around 1140 PM EDT. Claremont around 1150 PM EDT. Rustic around 1200 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Brandon and Taylors Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for south central, southeastern and east central Virginia.
